text: George Douglas Cochrane Newton, 1st Baron Eltisley (14 July 1879 – 2 September 1942) was a Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom. He was appointed High Sheriff of Cambridgeshire and Huntingdonshire for 1909. Following the First World War, he joined the Rural Reconstruction in the Department of the Ministry of Reconstruction. He was invested as a Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire in the 1919 New Year Honours. He was then elected as Member of Parliament for Cambridge at a by-election in 1922 following the resignation of the Conservative MP Sir Eric Geddes. Newton retained the seat at the 1922 general election, and was re-elected at four further elections until he was elevated to the peerage in 1934 as Baron Eltisley, of Croxton in the County of Cambridge. The title became extinct on his death in September 1942, aged 63. == References == * * == External links == * Category:1879 births Category:1942 deaths Category:British people of English descent Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Eltisley, George Douglas Cochrane Newton, 1st Baron Category:UK MPs 1918–1922 Category:UK MPs 1922–1923 Category:UK MPs 1923–1924 Category:UK MPs 1924–1929 Category:UK MPs 1929–1931 Category:UK MPs 1931–1935 Category:UK MPs who were granted peerages Category:High Sheriffs of Cambridgeshire and Huntingdonshire Eltisley, Geroge Newton, 1st Baron Category:Knights Commander of the Order of the British Empire
title: George Newton, 1st Baron Eltisley
